--- title: "Welcome" format: revealjs --- # Hello world! ## Data science - Data science is an exciting discipline that allows you to turn raw data into understanding, insight, and knowledge. - We're going to learn to do this in a `tidy` way -- more on that later! - This is a course on introduction to data science, with an emphasis on statistical thinking. ## Course FAQ **Q - What data science background does this course assume?**\ A - None. But it does require a willingness to learn and a motivation to work with data. . . . **Q - Will we be doing computing?**\ A - Yes. . . . **Q - What computing language will we learn?**\ A - R. . . . **Q: Why not language X?**\ A: A great discussion for the course forum! # Software ## Excel, not... ![](images/excel.png){fig-align="center"} ## R ![](images/r.png){fig-align="center"} ## RStudio ![](images/rstudio.png){fig-align="center"} # Data science life cycle ## Data science life cycle ![](images/data-science-cycle/data-science-cycle.001.png){fig-align="center"} ::: aside Wickham, Hadley, Mine Çetinkaya-Rundel, and Garrett Grolemund. "R for Data Science." O'Reilly Media, Inc.", 2023. ::: ## Import ![](images/data-science-cycle/data-science-cycle.002.png){fig-align="center"} ## Tidy -\> transform ![](images/data-science-cycle/data-science-cycle.003.png){fig-align="center"} ## Visualize ![](images/data-science-cycle/data-science-cycle.004.png){fig-align="center"} ## Model ![](images/data-science-cycle/data-science-cycle.005.png){fig-align="center"} ## Understand ![](images/data-science-cycle/data-science-cycle.006.png){fig-align="center"} ## Understand ::: columns ::: {.column width="40%"} ![](images/google-trend-index.png){fig-align="center" width="476"} ::: ::: {.column width="60%"} ![](images/data-science-cycle/data-science-cycle.006-cropped.png){fig-align="center"} ::: fragment ::: {.cell} ::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout} ``` # A tibble: 5 × 2 date season 1 23 January 2017 winter 2 4 March 2017 spring 3 14 June 2017 summer 4 1 September 2017 fall 5 ... ... ``` ::: ::: ::: ::: ::: ## Communicate ![](images/data-science-cycle/data-science-cycle.007.png){fig-align="center"} ## Understand + communicate ![](images/data-science-cycle/data-science-cycle.008.png){fig-align="center"} ## Program ![](images/data-science-cycle/data-science-cycle.009.png){fig-align="center"} ## Data visualization and transformation
![](images/data-science-cycle/data-science-cycle.010-cropped.png){fig-align="center"}

include-after-body:
<script>
  // htmlwidgets need to know to resize themselves when slides are shown/hidden.
  // Fire the "slideenter" event (handled by htmlwidgets.js) when the current
  // slide changes (different for each slide format).
  (function () {
    // dispatch for htmlwidgets
    function fireSlideEnter() {
      const event = window.document.createEvent("Event");
      event.initEvent("slideenter", true, true);
      window.document.dispatchEvent(event);
    }

    function fireSlideChanged(previousSlide, currentSlide) {
      fireSlideEnter();

      // dispatch for shiny
      if (window.jQuery) {
        if (previousSlide) {
          window.jQuery(previousSlide).trigger("hidden");
        }
        if (currentSlide) {
          window.jQuery(currentSlide).trigger("shown");
        }
      }
    }

    // hookup for slidy
    if (window.w3c_slidy) {
      window.w3c_slidy.add_observer(function (slide_num) {
        // slide_num starts at position 1
        fireSlideChanged(null, w3c_slidy.slides[slide_num - 1]);
      });
    }

  })();
</script>
